thread.title: Jimmy Fallon to be honoured by Harvard Lampoon
thread.title_full: Jimmy Fallon to be honoured by Harvard Lampoon | Entertainment & Showbiz from CTV News

author: The Associated Press
title: Jimmy Fallon to be honoured by Harvard Lampoon
text:
CAMBRIDGE, Mass. -- Jimmy Fallon is getting the royal treatment at Harvard.
The Tonight Show host and Saturday Night Live alum is being honoured Saturday by the Harvard Lampoon, America's oldest continuously published humour magazine.
The magazine is awarding Fallon its Elmer Award for Excellence in Humour.
The Harvard Lampoon's Facebook page says the comedian will be crowned "Emperor of Comedy" and paraded through Harvard Square in a Roman chariot. The parade will start by the Inn at Harvard and end at the steps of the magazine's headquarters, Lampoon Castle.
It's just the seventh time the undergraduate organization says it has bestowed the honour. Previous recipients include Jay Leno, John Cleese and Robin Williams.
The 41-year-old Fallon took over The Tonight Show from Leno last year.
